ud1.8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud1.8:1.3_0: Now at that time around Venerable Saṅgāmaji had arrived at Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.
ud1.8:1.4_0: The former wife heard her former wife.
ud1.8:1.6_0: and went to the Jetavana, taking their boy.
ud1.8:2.1_0: Now at that time Venerable Saṅgāmaji was sitting at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
ud1.8:2.2_0: Then his former wife went up to him.
ud1.8:2.2_1: He went up to battle and said,
ud1.8:2.4_0: When she said this, Saṅgāmaji kept silent.
ud1.8:3.1_0: For a second time she said,
ud1.8:3.3_0: For a second time, Saṅgāmaji kept silent.
ud1.8:4.1_0: For a third time she said,
ud1.8:4.3_0: And for a third time, Saṅgāmaji kept silent.
ud1.8:5.1_0: Then she put down the boy in front of Saṅgāmaji, saying,
ud1.8:5.2_0: “This is your child, ascetic. Provide for him.”
ud1.8:6.1_0: But Saṅgāmaji neither looked at the boy nor spoke to him.
ud1.8:6.2_0: Then his former wife went a little distance away. Looking back, she saw Saṅgāmaji ignoring the boy, and thought,
ud1.8:6.3_0: “This ascetic doesn’t even want his child.”
ud1.8:6.4_0: She returned to pick up the boy, then left.
ud1.8:6.5_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha saw how Saṅgāmaji’s went back for the child.
ud1.8:7.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud1.8:8.1_0: “When she came he was not glad,
ud1.8:8.2_0: when she left he did not grieve.
ud1.8:8.3_0: Victorious in battle, freed from chains,
ud1.8:8.4_0: I declare them to be one who follows.”
